availability.p: Copyright Records of Early English Drama (REED), 2024
availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) licence.

sourceDesc.p: Born digital. Information on original sources for transcriptions can be accessed via the Document Descriptions.

projectDesc.p: Records of Early English Drama (REED) is an international scholarly project that is establishing for the first time the context from which the drama of Shakespeare and his contemporaries grew. Founded in 1976, REED has worked since then to locate, transcribe, and edit historical documents containing evidence of drama, secular music, and other communal entertainment and ceremony from the Middle Ages until 1642, when the Puritans closed the London theatres.

div.head: Forthcoming Collections
div.p:
Robert J. Alexander — Percy Family
Sarah Carpenter — Scotland Royal Court
Mark Chambers — Durham (with John McKinnell)
John Craig — Norfolk (with James Stokes)
Callan Davies — Curtain Playhouse
Clare Egan — Derbyshire
Peter Greenfield — Bedfordshire, Hertfordshire, Norwich (2nd ed with Emily Mayne)
Tracey Hill — Civic London 1558-1642
Alexandra F. Johnston — Buckinghamshire, Oxfordshire
Sally-Beth MacLean — Surrey including Southwark
John J. McGavin — Scotland Provinces (with Eila Williamson)
C.E. McGee — Yorkshire West Riding (with Sylvia Thomas), Wiltshire
John McKinnell — Durham (with Mark Chambers)
Christopher Matusiak — Cockpit Playhouse
Emily Mayne — Norwich (2nd ed with Peter Greenfield)
Alan H. Nelson — Bridewell (with Duncan Salkeld), Essex
Dave Postles — Nottinghamshire
Catherine Richardson — Kent: Diocese of Rochester (with the late James Gibson)
Duncan Salkeld — Bridewell (with Alan Nelson)
J.A.B. Somerset — Warwickshire
James Stokes — Norfolk (with John Craig), Suffolk
Sylvia Thomas — Derbyshire, Yorkshire West Riding (with C.E. McGee)
Eila Williamson — Scotland Provinces (with John J. McGavin)
Diana Wyatt — Yorkshire East Riding
Contact Sally-Beth MacLean about collections in progress that are currently without an editor. These are Huntingdonshire, Leicestershire, Middlesex including Westminster, Northamptonshire, Northumberland, and Rutland.
